title: Bad Dreams

description.plain:
“Bad Dreams” is Teddy Swims’s anticipated follow-up to his successful singles Lose Control and The Door, both off his debut album, I’ve Tried Everything But Therapy (Part 1).

Teddy teased it on social media prior to its release, for instance on this Facebook reel:

https://www.facebook.com/reel/1597442271153921

A slick song about what is ostensibly Teddy’s favourite topic, heartbreak, Bad Dreams is graced with Dire Straits-esque guitar and impressively smooth vocals, and lyrically is Teddy telling his lover how much he misses her, and how much he is affected by her absence.

The song was a moderate success commercially.

embed_content: Read “Bad Dreams” by Teddy Swims on Genius

body.plain:
“Bad Dreams” is Teddy Swims’s anticipated follow-up to his successful singles Lose Control and The Door, both off his debut album, I’ve Tried Everything But Therapy (Part 1).

Teddy teased it on social media prior to its release, for instance on this Facebook reel:

https://www.facebook.com/reel/1597442271153921

A slick song about what is ostensibly Teddy’s favourite topic, heartbreak, Bad Dreams is graced with Dire Straits-esque guitar and impressively smooth vocals, and lyrically is Teddy telling his lover how much he misses her, and how much he is affected by her absence.

The song was a moderate success commercially.

Sun is going down, time is running out
No one else around but me
Steady losing light, steady losing my mind
Moving shadows and grinding teeth (Ooh)

Without you, there ain't no place for me to hide
Without you, there's no way I can sleep tonight
What I'd do for a little bit of peace and quiet
Without you, I keep

Slipping into bad dreams (Bad dreams)
Where there's no you and I
No sound when I cry
I love you and I need you to set me free
From all of these

No sound when I cry
